oldestTicket.Subject: [Security] Check DC1 NETLOGON Logs for Access Attempts

ticket.Subject: Credential/website bio update
ticket.Ticket_Body:
Good afternoon,
I passed my FNP exam today (I attached the pass report). Can we update my credentials where need be (like my signature on email and my credentials on teams, Kipu,Â etc.) I will have the license number for HR within a few days. Can we also update my Bio on the
 Banyan website? Abigail I cc'd you as you may tend to that now.Â  My name should read as Danielle Stevens, MSN. FNP-BC.
The bio update should be as follows:
Danielle Stevens, MSN, FNP-BC, is a proud Florida native, born and raised in Miami. She relocated to Martin County in 1997 and has since dedicated her life to serving individuals facing some of the most complex health challenges, particularly in the fields
 of mental health and substance use.
Danielleâ€™s career in healthcare began as a Behavioral Health Technician (BHT) in an all-male mental health correctional facility. This role sparked her deep commitment to working with underserved populations, especially those struggling with dual diagnoses.
 Determined to make a greater impact, Danielle became a Licensed Practical Nurse and later an RN, gaining hands-on experience in detox and recovery settings.
She joined Banyan in Downtown Stuart as the Director of Nursing for Detox, where she built and led a multidisciplinary nursing team with backgrounds spanning emergency care and behavioral health. Her leadership helped shape a patient-centered and compassionate
 environment designed to support clients throughout every stage of recovery. She now serves as the National Director of Clinical Review, partnering with admissions and clinical teams to ensure that clients receive the timely, medically appropriate care they
 need.
Danielle has recently achieved a major milestone: earning her Master of Science in Nursing and passing her board certification as a Family Nurse Practitioner (FNP-BC). She remains deeply passionate about mental health, addiction medicine, and integrated care,
 with future plans to expand her scope to include functional medicine. Danielle brings not only clinical knowledge but also a deeply personal sense of purpose to every patient interaction, believing in second chances, compassionate care, and the healing power
 of human connection.
Thank you all for your help in advance!
Danielle

National Director of Clinical Review

ticket.Subject: Credential/website bio update
ticket.Ticket_Body:
Good afternoon,
I passed my FNP exam today (I attached the pass report). Can we update my credentials where need be (like my signature on email and my credentials on teams, Kipu,Â etc.) I will have the license number for HR within a few days. Can we also update my Bio on the
 Banyan website? Abigail I cc'd you as you may tend to that now.Â  My name should read as Danielle Stevens, MSN. FNP-BC.
The bio update should be as follows:
Danielle Stevens, MSN, FNP-BC, is a proud Florida native, born and raised in Miami. She relocated to Martin County in 1997 and has since dedicated her life to serving individuals facing some of the most complex health challenges, particularly in the fields
 of mental health and substance use.
Danielleâ€™s career in healthcare began as a Behavioral Health Technician (BHT) in an all-male mental health correctional facility. This role sparked her deep commitment to working with underserved populations, especially those struggling with dual diagnoses.
 Determined to make a greater impact, Danielle became a Licensed Practical Nurse and later an RN, gaining hands-on experience in detox and recovery settings.
She joined Banyan in Downtown Stuart as the Director of Nursing for Detox, where she built and led a multidisciplinary nursing team with backgrounds spanning emergency care and behavioral health. Her leadership helped shape a patient-centered and compassionate
 environment designed to support clients throughout every stage of recovery. She now serves as the National Director of Clinical Review, partnering with admissions and clinical teams to ensure that clients receive the timely, medically appropriate care they
 need.
Danielle has recently achieved a major milestone: earning her Master of Science in Nursing and passing her board certification as a Family Nurse Practitioner (FNP-BC). She remains deeply passionate about mental health, addiction medicine, and integrated care,
 with future plans to expand her scope to include functional medicine. Danielle brings not only clinical knowledge but also a deeply personal sense of purpose to every patient interaction, believing in second chances, compassionate care, and the healing power
 of human connection.
Thank you all for your help in advance!
Danielle
Danielle Stevens MSN, RN
National Director of Clinical Review
